data.title: Manisha Koirala says a famous photographer told her off for refusing to wear bikini
meta_keywords: Manisha Koirala talks about photographer asking her to wear a bikini
data.meta_description: Veteran actor Manisha Koirala recently opened up about an early career incident involving a famous photographer who asked her to pose in a bikini. Despite his insistence, she refused, citing her principles.
data.text:
Veteran actor Manisha Koirala, who was recently seen in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi', recently spoke about an early career incident when she was asked to pose in a two-piece bikini by a famous photographer.

While she often wears a bikini while swimming, she didn't find it necessary for the photoshoot and refused. In an interview with Filmfare, she said, "Very early on in my career I was asked to take photographs by a very famous photographer. I went with my mom, and initially, he said things like, 'You are the next superstar.' Then he brought a two-piece bikini and asked me to wear it. I told him, 'Sir, I wear this when I go to the beach or for a swim, but if this is the way I have to get into the movies, I don't want it, and I am not wearing that.'"

After getting to know her attitude, the photographer told her off. She recalled, "I told him either you shoot me fully clothed, otherwise I am. He gave me a big dialogue, 'Jo mitti pighalne se sharmati ho uske murti kaise banaye (The clay that refuses to melt, how do I make a statue from it?).' I have not forgotten that."

Manisha admitted that this was the mentality of some people during the 90s. She also recalled that the same photographer had to click her later in her career, when she had become a big star, and he quickly ate his words, saying, "Oh, I knew you were going to be a big star."

While Manisha wasn't happy with his behaviour, she also understood his perspective, "Not to be mean to the person, but that was their conscience. Their exposure was that, so they behaved like that," she added.

Manisha played the pivotal role of Malikajaan in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's debut web show Heeramandi and received much praise for her performance. Before the web show, she starred in Kartik Aaryan's Shehzada in 2023.
